definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest

sentences.english: There is money to be made (indirectly for the creatives) by finding talent.
sentences.chinese: 发现天才就是生财之道。

sentences.english: And gas riches, honest service is our aim.
sentences.chinese: 和气生财，诚信服务，是我们的宗旨。

sentences.english: This, in turn, can also give birth to many other wealth-generating projects.
sentences.chinese: 这最终也会带来很多其它生财项目。

sentences.english: As the saying puts, harmony brings wealth.

definition: profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
Mandate of Heaven/the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC/usually written 大運河|大运河[Da4 Yun4 he2]
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
